tModLoader.MenuDownloadModsDescription: The in-game Mod Browser to find, download, and update your Mods.
tModLoader.MenuManageModsDescription: Manage which Mods are active, delete Mods, and configure your Modpacks.
tModLoader.MenuDevelopModsDescription: Develop and publish Mods for others to use, using your Mod Source code
tModLoader.MenuModPackDescription: Manage Mod Packs, for features like saving your current list of mods & config, and Import & Export Mod Packs. Experimental.
tModLoader.WelcomeMessageBeta:
Welcome to tModLoader 1.4 Alpha.

You have successfully installed an unstable version of tModLoader that may contain game-breaking bugs. 

Use the Workshop menu to access tModLoader Mod related functions.

Join the tModLoader Discord to learn more about which testing mods and/or tools are available for 1.4 tModLoader as part of its 1.4 overhaul.
tModLoader.WelcomeMessageUpgradeBeta:
Welcome to tModLoader Beta.

You have successfully installed an unstable version of tModLoader that may contain game-breaking bugs. 

Use the Workshop menu to access tModLoader Mod related functions.

Join the tModLoader Discord to learn more about which testing mods and/or tools are available for tModLoader as part of its Terraria version upgrade.
tModLoader.MonthlyFreezeNotification:
The monthly freeze has started. As a reminder, on the 21st of each month, there is a period of time where modders are expected to publish an update for their mods on the 1.4-preview branch in anticipation for all of the code and API changes to tModLoader that were made over the last month. The current 1.4-preview will become the new 1.4-stable (default) on the 1st of next month.

Failure to do so will mean that mods you've made will likely fail to load starting on the 1st of next month.

Join the tModLoader Discord to learn more about the changes from this month and view migration notes. Click "More Info" to learn more about the continous release cycle.
tModLoader.WelcomeMessagePreview:
WARNING: Player Beware!!
This is a monthly preview build with breaking changes, and thus mods will be broken.
[c/ff1919:DO NOT ask modders to fix their mods for this preview build.]
This Preview branch provides opportunity for modders to update their mods on THEIR own schedule.

Click "More Info" to learn more about the continuous release cycle.

Join the tModLoader Discord to learn more about the changes from this month and view migration notes.
tModLoader.FirstLaunchWelcomeMessage:
Welcome to tModLoader.

You have successfully installed tModLoader. Use the Workshop menu to access tModLoader Mod related functions.

If you were playing through 1.3 prior to today you can revert back by switching to the 1.3-legacy beta branch in Steam. If you can't find the mods you were planning to play with, they might only exist on 1.3 for now.

If you are not a contributor to that mod then attempting to publish will fail. If this is your mod, double check that you are logged into the correct Steam account. Every mod must have a unique internal name.

tModLoader.NoWorkshopAccess:
Error: Unable to access Steam Workshop.

You must have a valid Steam install on your system in order to use the in-game Mod Browser.

NOTE: GoG users - once Steam is installed, you can use the ingame mod browser to download mods
tModLoader.ModAlreadyUploaded: Error: Mod already exists on Workshop!
tModLoader.ModVersionTooSmall:
Error: Mod Version information must be incremented prior to updating.

The current version (v{0}) needs to be larger than the version already on the Workshop (v{1}).
tModLoader.ModVersionLargerThanFutureVersions:
Error: Mod Version can't exceed the version of this mod published on newer releases of tModLoader.

The current version (v{0}) needs to be smaller than or equal to existing versions already on the Workshop made for newer releases of tModLoader (v{1} was published on tModLoader v{2}).

If the current version number is desired for this release, a workaround is to publish an even larger version on tModLoader v{2} and then publish v{0} on this tModLoader release.
tModLoader.ConsultSteamLogs: Consult Steam workshop_log.txt (Default Location: {0}) for more information.
tModLoader.SteamRejectUpdate:
Item is/was already installed: {0}. 
If attempting to re-install, restart your game first because Steam is weird
If restarting your game does not work, apply the following steps:
1) Open Steam Client
2) Find the Mod on tModLoader Workshop
3) Unsubscribe and Resubscribe on the actual Workshop.
These steps are required if Steam fails to handle unsubscribing you properly.

tModLoader.MBOfflineTroubleshooting:
The Mod Browser can't be reached, this can be due to many reasons.
 1. Check your Internet connection.
 2. The Mod Browser might just be offline. If it worked before, just wait a few hours.
 3. Double-click this message to open the Mod Browser website. You can use this to manually download mods. If this works, you should check your firewall to allow Terraria.exe through or try disabling your VPN if you are using one.
 4. If that website does not work, the Mod Browser server might be blocked by your Government, Internet Service Provider, Router, or Web Filter. If that is the case, you'll need to figure it out on your own.

tModLoader.MigratePlayersMessage:
You have no players.
If you'd like to manually migrate your players from vanilla to tModLoader,
please copy them from
/Terraria/Players
to
/Terraria/{0}/Players.
Copy the .plr file and the similarly named folder over.
Click me to open those folders.
After copying over the players you want, press back.
tModLoader.MigratePlayersText: Click here to automatically migrate players from Terraria...
tModLoader.MigratePlayersException: There was a problem while trying to migrate Player files
tModLoader.MigrateWorldsMessage:
You have no worlds.
If you'd like to manually migrate your worlds from vanilla to tModLoader,
you can press the migrate button below to do so automatically.
Alternatively, you can copy them from
/Terraria/Worlds
to
/Terraria/{0}/Worlds manually.
Copy the .wld files over.
Click this text to open those folders.
After copying over the worlds you want, press back.
tModLoader.MigrateWorldsText: Click here to automatically migrate worlds from Terraria...

tModLoader.DiscordLink: Find Help on the Discord Server
tModLoader.MSFirstLaunchModderWelcomeMessage:
Welcome to the Develop Mods menu. This menu is for those making mods. Here you'll be able to build your mod.

If you are new to making mods, please click the "View on GitHub" button below to visit our wiki and look for the "I am new to modding" section.
tModLoader.MSNetSDKNotFound: Making mods for tModLoader requires the .NET {0} SDK to be installed, but it has not been detected. Click the "Download .NET {0} SDK" button below for installation instructions. After installing, you may need to restart tModLoader.
tModLoader.DevModsInSandbox: tModLoader cannot develop mods while running in a sandbox (such as Flatpak). Please make sure to install Steam directly on your system.
tModLoader.CreateModNameInvalid: ModName is invalid C# identifier. Remove spaces.
tModLoader.CreateModNameReserved: ModName is a reserved mod name. Choose a different name.
tModLoader.CreateModBasicSwordInvalid: BasicSword is invalid C# identifier. Remove spaces.
tModLoader.DMModCompileMissing: Extra libraries are required to build mods. (ModCompile folder missing)
tModLoader.DMModCompileUpdate: ModCompile folder version mismatch. Terraria: {0}, ModCompile: {1}
tModLoader.DMModCompileDev:
Use the tModLoader development setup tool to generate/update the ModCompile folder (SetupDebugging).
Otherwise rebuild {0}
tModLoader.DMDotNetUpdateRequired: .NET Framework {0} or newer is required to build mods. Please download the latest .NET Framework.
tModLoader.DMMonoUpdateRequired: Mono {0} or newer is required to build mods. Please install the latest Mono.
tModLoader.DMMonoRuntimeRequired: Terraria must be launched with Mono {0} or newer to build mods. Please update your start scripts.

tModLoader.DMTutorialWelcome: Welcome to modding with tModLoader. Check out the Wiki for more information and tutorials.
tModLoader.DMScriptsRequireRestart: Start scripts have been updated and require tModLoader to be restarted.
tModLoader.DMUpdateMonoToDownloadModCompile: Extra libraries can be downloaded from github when running on an up-to-date version of Mono.

tModLoader.ExtractNoSourceCodeMessage: The modder has not chosen to include their source code.
tModLoader.ExtractHideResourcesMessage: The modder has chosen to hide resources (ie. images) from tModReader.
tModLoader.CommandModListDescription: Displays a list of loaded mods.
tModLoader.CompilationResult: Compilation finished with {0} errors and {1} warnings
tModLoader.DefaultTownNPCChat: My modder forgot to give me a chat message.
tModLoader.DefaultNurseCantHealChat: I don't know why I can't heal you, the modder forgot to give me a chat message.
tModLoader.NoAttackSpeedScaling: Does not scale with attack speed
tModLoader.ModifiedByModsHoldSHIFT: Is modified (hold SHIFT for more info)
tModLoader.DeleteModConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete this mod permanently?
tModLoader.WorldGenError: A problem was encountered during world generation
tModLoader.WorldIODataException: The game encountered a mod data problem for a world.
tModLoader.WatchLocalizationFileMessage: The following localization files have changed and will be reloaded: {0}
tModLoader.ContentFolderNotFound: Terraria Content folder not found. If you installed tModLoader through Steam, make sure that Terraria is installed. If not, make sure to install tModLoader in a folder nested within the Terraria install directory or a folder next to the Terraria install directory.
tModLoader.OutOfMemory: Game ran out of memory. You'll have to find which mod is consuming lots of memory, and contact the devs or remove it.
tModLoader.VanillaSteamInstallationNotFound:
Terraria Steam installation or Terraria Content directory not found.

Please ensure Terraria 1.4 is installed through Steam.
tModLoader.SteamAPIHashMismatch:
Steam API hash mismatch, assumed pirated.

tModLoader requires a legitimate Terraria install to work.
tModLoader.SteamInitFailed:
SteamAPI.Init failed. Try logging out of Steam and restarting it.

Check terrariasteamclient.log and Natives.Log for details
tModLoader.TerrariaNotInstalled:
Terraria must be installed on steam for tModLoader to run.

You will need to re-start your steam client for the install button to appear in the Terraria app.

Start Terraria at least once to ensure dependencies get installed before launching tModLoader again.
tModLoader.GOGHashMismatch:
{0} is not the unmodified Terraria {1} executable.

This release of tModLoader expects to be installed alongside Terraria {1}. If Terraria recently updated, you may have to downgrade to this earlier release in GOG Galaxy.

If you patched the .exe, you can create a copy of the original exe and name it "{2}"
tModLoader.DefaultExtraMessage: Please restore your Terraria install, then install tModLoader on Steam or by following the README.txt instructions for manual installation.
tModLoader.OutOfMemoryHint: Tip: Try running less mods at once, or determine if a mod is taking up too much memory.
tModLoader.ModExceptionHint: Tip: This is likely a mod's fault. Disable mods one by one and check if the issue persists
tModLoader.OneDriveHint: Tip: Try installing/enabling OneDrive. Right click your Documents folder and enable "Always save on this device"
tModLoader.AntivirusHint: Tip: If you have an antivirus, try adding Terraria to its whitelist/exclusion list
tModLoader.TypeInitializationHint: Tip: Restart the game. If this issue persists, try uninstalling Terraria completely, then reinstalling through Steam, and then reinstalling tModLoader
tModLoader.TerrariaOutOfDateMessage: Terraria is out of date, you need to update Terraria in Steam.
tModLoader.TerrariaLegacyBranchMessage: Terraria is on a legacy version, you need to switch back to the normal Terraria version in Steam for tModLoader to load.
tModLoader.TagsContentDescription: Adds new content (i.e. items, weapons, npcs, etc.) to the game
tModLoader.TagsLibraryDescription: Provides additional API & features useful to modders
tModLoader.TagsQoLDescription: Features or changes that reduce time spent on typically less fun tasks.
tModLoader.TagsGameplayDescription: Tweaks that change or improve vanilla gameplay
tModLoader.TagsAudioDescription: Tweaks that change existing audio (i.e. new boss themes, etc.)
tModLoader.TagsVisualDescription: Tweaks that change existing visualization (i.e. particle effects, etc.)
tModLoader.TagsGenDescription: Changes the way the world is generated (i.e. ores, new structures, etc.)
tModLoader.TagsLanguage_Description: This mod is localized for this language.

Conditions.WorldNotForTheWorthy: Not in a For The Worthy world
Conditions.WorldNotDontStarve: Not in a Don't Starve world
Conditions.WorldNotNoTraps: Not in a No Traps world
Conditions.HappyEnough: When the vendor is happy enough
Conditions.DownedEyeOfCthulhu: After defeating the Eye of Cthulhu
Conditions.DownedBoss2: After defeating Eater of Worlds or Brain of Cthulhu
Conditions.DownedEarlygameBoss: After defeating the Eye of Cthulhu, Eater of Worlds, Brain of Cthulhu, Queen Bee or Skeletron
Conditions.DownedOldOnesArmyAny: After defeating any tier Old One's Army
Conditions.DownedOldOnesArmyT1: After defeating tier 1 Old One's Army
Conditions.DownedOldOnesArmyT2: After defeating tier 2 Old One's Army
Conditions.DownedOldOnesArmyT3: After defeating tier 3 Old One's Army
Conditions.NotDownedEyeOfCthulhu: Before defeating the Eye of Cthulhu
Conditions.NotDownedBoss2: Before defeating Eater of Worlds or Brain of Cthulhu
Conditions.NotDownedOldOnesArmyAny: Before defeating any tier Old One's Army
Conditions.NotDownedOldOnesArmyT1: Before defeating tier 1 Old One's Army
Conditions.NotDownedOldOnesArmyT2: Before defeating tier 2 Old One's Army
Conditions.NotDownedOldOnesArmyT3: Before defeating tier 3 Old One's Army
Conditions.PlayerCarriesItem: When the player has a {0} in their inventory
Conditions.PlayerCarriesItem2: When the player has a {0} or {1} in the inventory
Conditions.IsNpcShimmered: When the vendor is a shimmer variant
Conditions.AtleastXHealth: When the player has at least {0} maximum life
Conditions.AtleastXMana: When the player has at least {0} maximum mana
Conditions.PlatinumCoin: When the player has at least 1 platinum coin in their inventory.
Conditions.GolfScoreOver: When the player has a golf score of {0} or more
Conditions.BestiaryPercentage: When the Bestiary has been filled to at least {0}%
Conditions.BestiaryFull: When the Bestiary has been filled completely
Conditions.BestiaryWinx: When the Bestiary contains entries for all three fairies
Conditions.OnTeam: When the player is on a team in multiplayer
Conditions.StyleMoon: During the night and following day of moon phases Waning Gibbous, Waning Crescent, Waxing Crescent and Waxing Gibbous
Conditions.DownedB2B3HM: After defeating Eater of Worlds, Brain of Cthulhu, Skeletron, or Wall of Flesh
Conditions.DaytimeNotFullMoon: During daytime, during any moon phase except full
Conditions.NightDayFullMoon: At night, or all day during a full moon
Conditions.NoAteLoaf: When the player has not consumed an Artisan Loaf before
Conditions.BloodOrSun: During a Blood Moon or Solar Eclipse
Conditions.NotBloodOrSun: Not during a Blood Moon or Solar Eclipse
Conditions.HardmodeFTW: In Hardmode when in a For the Worthy world, otherwise anytime
Conditions.NightOrEclipse: At night or during Solar Eclipse
Conditions.BloodMoonOrHardmode: During a Blood Moon, or anytime in Hardmode
Conditions.WorldGenSilver: In a world with Silver Ore
Conditions.WorldGenTungsten: In a world with Tungsten Ore
Conditions.NightAfterEvilOrHardmode: During the night after defeating the Eater of Worlds or Brain of Cthulhu, or anytime in Hardmode
Conditions.AnglerQuestsFinishedOver: When the player has finished {0} Angler Quests or more
Conditions.HappyEnoughForPylons: When the vendor is happy enough to sell pylons
Conditions.AnotherTownNPCNearby: When the vendor has another Town NPC nearby
Conditions.ForestPylon: On the surface and not in another pylon biome
Conditions.UndergroundPylon: Below the surface and not in another pylon biome
Conditions.MoonPhasesHalf0OrPreHardmode: Anytime before hardmode, or during a full, waning gibbous, third quarter or waning crescent moon
Conditions.MoonPhasesQuarter0: During a full or waning gibbous moon
Conditions.MoonPhasesQuarter1: During a third quarter or waning crescent moon
Conditions.MoonPhasesQuarter2: During a new or waxing crescent moon
Conditions.MoonPhasesQuarter3: During a first quarter or waxing gibbous moon
Conditions.MoonPhasesHalf0: During a full, waning gibbous, third quarter or waning crescent moon
Conditions.MoonPhasesHalf1: During a new, waxing crescent, first quarter or waxing gibbous moon
Conditions.MoonPhasesEven: During a full, third quarter, new or first quarter moon
Conditions.MoonPhasesOdd: During a gibbous or crescent moon
Conditions.MoonPhasesNearNew: During a third quarter, waning crescent or new moon
Conditions.MoonPhasesEvenQuarters: During a full, waning gibbous, new or waxing crescent moon
Conditions.MoonPhasesOddQuarters: During a third quarter, waning crescent, first quarter or waxing gibbous moon
Conditions.MoonPhases04: During a full or new moon
Conditions.MoonPhases15: During a waning gibbous or waxing crescent moon
Conditions.MoonPhases26: During a third quarter or first quarter moon
Conditions.MoonPhases37: During a waning crescent or waxing gibbous moon

Mods.ModLoader.Items.StartBag.Tooltip:
Some starting items couldn't fit in your inventory
{$CommonItemTooltip.RightClickToOpen}
Mods.ModLoader.Items.Jofairden_Body.Tooltip: The power of the Andromedon flows within you
Mods.ModLoader.Items.Jofairden_Head.Tooltip: The power of the Andromedon flows within you
Mods.ModLoader.Items.Jofairden_Legs.Tooltip: The power of the Andromedon flows within you
Mods.ModLoader.Items.Linus_Body.Tooltip:
'One of the standard articles of hunter attire fashioned at the workshop,
accompanied with a short cape that wipes away blood.
Allows one to stalk beasts unannounced, by cover of night.'
Mods.ModLoader.Items.Linus_Head.Tooltip:
'One of the standard articles of hunter attire fashioned at the workshop.
Recognizable by its withered feathers, this cap is fashioned after one of the old hunters.'
Mods.ModLoader.Items.Linus_Legs.Tooltip:
'One of the standard articles of hunter attire, fashioned at the workshop.
Allows one to stalk beasts unannounced, by cover of night.'
Mods.ModLoader.Items.Linus_Wings.Tooltip:
'One of the secret rites of the Choir.
But it seems to have been repurposed by Linus.'
Mods.ModLoader.Items.xAqult_Body.Tooltip:
'Make peace, especially with your own soul.'
(xAqult's Vanity Set)
Mods.ModLoader.Items.xAqult_Legs.Tooltip:
'Stand calmly and remember to focus.'
(xAqult's Vanity Set)
Mods.ModLoader.Items.xAqult_Mask.Tooltip:
'There can be only one.'
(xAqult's Vanity Set)
Mods.ModLoader.Items.xAqult_Wings.Tooltip:
'Light and Dark. Perfectly balanced, as all things should be.'
(xAqult's Vanity Set)
